verses.verse: And<WG1161> Paul<WG3972>, earnestly beholding<WG816> the council<WG4892>, said<WG2036>, Men<WG435> and brethren<WG80>, I<WG1473> have lived<WG4176> in all<WG3956> good<WG18> conscience<WG4893> before God<WG2316> until<WG891> this<WG5026> day<WG2250>.
And<WG1161> the high priest<WG749> Ananias<WG367> commanded<WG2004> them that stood by<WG3936> him<WG846> to smite<WG5180> him<WG846> on the mouth<WG4750>.

Then<WG5119> said<WG2036> Paul<WG3972> unto<WG4314> him<WG846>, God<WG2316> shall<WG3195> smite<WG5180> thee<WG4571>, thou whited<WG2867> wall<WG5109>: for<WG2532> sittest<WG2521> thou<WG4771> to judge<WG2919> me<WG3165> after<WG2596> the law<WG3551>, and<WG2532> commandest<WG2753> me<WG3165> to be smitten<WG5180> contrary to the law<WG3891>?
And<WG1161> they that stood by<WG3936> said<WG2036>, Revilest thou<WG3058> God's<WG2316> high priest<WG749>?

Then<WG5037> said<WG5346> Paul<WG3972>, I wist<WG1492> not<WG3756>, brethren<WG80>, that<WG3754> he was<WG2076> the high priest<WG749>: for<WG1063> it is written<WG1125>, Thou shalt<WG2046> not<WG3756> speak<WG2046> evil<WG2560> of the ruler<WG758> of thy<WG4675> people<WG2992>.

But<WG1161> when Paul<WG3972> perceived<WG1097> that<WG3754> the one<WG1520> part<WG3313> were<WG2076> Sadducees<WG4523>, and<WG1161> the other<WG2087> Pharisees<WG5330>, he cried out<WG2896> in<WG1722> the council<WG4892>, Men<WG435> and brethren<WG80>, I<WG1473> am<WG1510> a Pharisee<WG5330>, the son<WG5207> of a Pharisee<WG5330>: of<WG4012> the hope<WG1680> and<WG2532> resurrection<WG386> of the dead<WG3498> I<WG1473> am called in question<WG2919>.

And<WG1161> when he<WG846> had<WG2980> so<WG5124> said<WG2980>, there arose<WG1096> a dissension<WG4714> between the Pharisees<WG5330> and<WG2532> the Sadducees<WG4523>: and<WG2532> the multitude<WG4128> was divided<WG4977>.

For<WG1063><WG3303> the Sadducees<WG4523> say<WG3004> that there is<WG1511> no<WG3361> resurrection<WG386>, neither<WG3366> angel<WG32>, nor<WG3383> spirit<WG4151>: but<WG1161> the Pharisees<WG5330> confess<WG3670> both<WG297>.

And<WG1161> there arose<WG1096> a great<WG3173> cry<WG2906>: and<WG2532> the scribes<WG1122> that were of the Pharisees'<WG5330> part<WG3313> arose<WG450>, and strove<WG1264>, saying<WG3004>, We find<WG2147> no<WG3762> evil<WG2556> in<WG1722> this<WG5129> man<WG444>: but<WG1161> if<WG1487> a spirit<WG4151> or<WG2228> an angel<WG32> hath spoken<WG2980> to him<WG846>, let us<WG2313> not<WG3361> fight<WG2313> against God.

And<WG1161> when there arose<WG1096> a great<WG4183> dissension<WG4714>, the chief captain<WG5506>, fearing<WG2125> lest<WG3361> Paul<WG3972> should have been pulled in pieces<WG1288> of<WG5259> them<WG846>, commanded<WG2753> the soldiers<WG4753> to go down<WG2597>, and to take<WG726> him<WG846> by force<WG726> from<WG1537> among<WG3319> them<WG846>, and<WG5037> to bring<WG71> him into<WG1519> the castle<WG3925>.

And<WG1161> the night<WG3571> following<WG1966> the Lord<WG2962> stood by<WG2186> him<WG846>, and said<WG2036>, Be of good cheer<WG2293>, Paul<WG3972>: for<WG1063> as<WG5613> thou hast testified<WG1263> of<WG4012> me<WG1700> in<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2419>, so<WG3779> must<WG1163> thou<WG4571> bear witness<WG3140> also<WG2532> at<WG1519> Rome<WG4516>.

And<WG1161> when it was<WG1096> day<WG2250>, certain<WG5100> of the Jews<WG2453> banded together<WG4160><WG4963>, and bound<WG332> themselves<WG1438> under a curse<WG332>, saying<WG3004> that they would<WG5315> neither<WG3383> eat<WG5315> nor<WG3383> drink<WG4095> till<WG2193><WG3739> they had killed<WG615> Paul<WG3972>.
And<WG1161> they were<WG2258> more than<WG4119> forty<WG5062> which<WG3588> had made<WG4160> this<WG5026> conspiracy<WG4945>.

And they<WG3748> came to<WG4334> the chief priests<WG749> and<WG2532> elders<WG4245>, and said<WG2036>, We have bound<WG332> ourselves<WG1438> under a great curse<WG331>, that we will eat<WG1089> nothing<WG3367> until<WG2193><WG3739> we have slain<WG615> Paul<WG3972>.

Now<WG3568> therefore<WG3767> ye<WG5210> with<WG4862> the council<WG4892> signify<WG1718> to the chief captain<WG5506> that<WG3704> he bring<WG2609> him<WG846> down<WG2609> unto<WG4314> you<WG5209> to morrow<WG839>, as<WG5613> though ye would<WG3195> inquire<WG1231> something more perfectly<WG197> concerning<WG4012> him<WG846>: and<WG1161> we<WG2249>, or ever<WG4253> he<WG846> come near<WG1448>, are<WG2070> ready<WG2092> to kill<WG337> him<WG846>.

And<WG1161> when Paul's<WG3972> sister's<WG79> son<WG5207> heard<WG191> of their lying in wait<WG1749>, he went<WG3854> and<WG2532> entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> the castle<WG3925>, and told<WG518> Paul<WG3972>.

Then<WG1161> Paul<WG3972> called<WG4341> one<WG1520> of the centurions<WG1543> unto him, and said<WG5346>, Bring<WG520> this<WG5126> young man<WG3494> unto<WG4314> the chief captain<WG5506>: for<WG1063> he hath<WG2192> a certain thing<WG5100> to tell<WG518> him<WG846>.

So<WG3767><WG3303> he took<WG3880> him<WG846>, and brought<WG71> him to<WG4314> the chief captain<WG5506>, and<WG2532> said<WG5346>, Paul<WG3972> the prisoner<WG1198> called<WG4341> me<WG3165> unto him, and prayed me<WG2065> to bring<WG71> this<WG5126> young man<WG3494> unto<WG4314> thee<WG4571>, who hath<WG2192> something<WG5100> to say<WG2980> unto thee<WG4671>.

Then<WG1161> the chief captain<WG5506> took<WG1949> him<WG846> by the hand<WG5495>, and<WG2532> went with him aside<WG402> privately<WG2596><WG2398>, and asked<WG4441> him, What<WG5101> is<WG2076> that<WG3739> thou hast<WG2192> to tell<WG518> me<WG3427>?

And<WG1161> he said<WG2036><WG3754>, The Jews<WG2453> have agreed<WG4934> to desire<WG2065> thee<WG4571> that<WG3704> thou wouldest bring down<WG2609> Paul<WG3972> to morrow<WG839> into<WG1519> the council<WG4892>, as<WG5613> though they would<WG3195> inquire<WG4441> somewhat<WG5100> of<WG4012> him<WG846> more perfectly<WG197>.

But<WG3767> do<WG3982> not<WG3361> thou<WG4771> yield<WG3982> unto them<WG846>: for<WG1063> there lie in wait for<WG1748> him<WG846> of<WG1537> them<WG846> more than<WG4119> forty<WG5062> men<WG435>, which<WG3748> have bound<WG332> themselves<WG1438> with an oath<WG332>, that they will<WG5315> neither<WG3383> eat<WG5315> nor<WG3383> drink<WG4095> till<WG2193><WG3739> they have killed<WG337> him<WG846>: and<WG2532> now<WG3568> are they<WG1526> ready<WG2092>, looking for<WG4327> a promise<WG1860> from<WG575> thee<WG4675>.

So<WG3303><WG3767> the chief captain<WG5506> then let<WG630> the young man<WG3494> depart<WG630>, and charged<WG3853> him, See thou tell<WG1583> no man<WG3367> that<WG3754> thou hast shewed<WG1718> these things<WG5023> to<WG4314> me<WG3165>.

And<WG2532> he called unto<WG4341> him<WG5100> two<WG1417> centurions<WG1543>, saying<WG2036>, Make ready<WG2090> two hundred<WG1250> soldiers<WG4757> to<WG3704> go<WG4198> to<WG2193> Caesarea<WG2542>, and<WG2532> horsemen<WG2460> threescore and ten<WG1440>, and<WG2532> spearmen<WG1187> two hundred<WG1250>, at<WG575> the third<WG5154> hour<WG5610> of the night<WG3571>;
And<WG5037> provide<WG3936> them beasts<WG2934>, that<WG2443> they may set<WG1913> Paul<WG3972> on<WG1913>, and bring him safe<WG1295> unto<WG4314> Felix<WG5344> the governor<WG2232>.
And he wrote<WG1125> a letter<WG1992> after<WG4023> this<WG5126> manner<WG5179>:
Claudius<WG2804> Lysias<WG3079> unto the most excellent<WG2903> governor<WG2232> Felix<WG5344> sendeth greeting<WG5463>.

This<WG5126> man<WG435> was taken<WG4815> of<WG5259> the Jews<WG2453>, and<WG2532> should<WG3195> have been killed<WG337> of<WG5259> them<WG846>: then came I<WG2186> with<WG4862> an army<WG4753>, and rescued<WG1807> him<WG846>, having understood<WG3129> that<WG3754> he was<WG2076> a Roman<WG4514>.

And<WG1161> when<WG1014> I would<WG1014> have known<WG1097> the cause<WG156> wherefore<WG1223><WG3739> they accused<WG1458> him<WG846>, I brought<WG2609> him<WG846> forth<WG2609> into<WG1519> their<WG846> council<WG4892>:

Whom<WG3739> I perceived<WG2147> to be accused<WG1458> of<WG4012> questions<WG2213> of their<WG846> law<WG3551>, but<WG1161> to have<WG2192> nothing<WG3367> laid to his charge<WG1462> worthy<WG514> of death<WG2288> or<WG2228> of bonds<WG1199>.

And<WG1161> when it was told<WG3377> me<WG3427> how that<WG5259> the Jews<WG2453> laid wait<WG1917><WG3195><WG1510> for<WG1519> the man<WG435>, I sent<WG3992> straightway<WG1824> to<WG4314> thee<WG4571>, and gave commandment<WG3853> to his accusers<WG2725> also<WG2532> to say<WG3004> before<WG1909> thee<WG4675> what they had against<WG4314> him<WG846>. Farewell<WG4517>.
Then<WG3767><WG3303> the soldiers<WG4757>, as<WG2596> it was commanded<WG1299> them<WG846>, took<WG353> Paul<WG3972>, and brought<WG71> him by<WG1223> night<WG3571> to<WG1519> Antipatris<WG494>.
<WG1161>On the morrow<WG1887> they left<WG1439> the horsemen<WG2460> to go<WG4198> with<WG4862> him<WG846>, and returned<WG5290> to<WG1519> the castle<WG3925>:

Who<WG3748>, when they came<WG1525> to<WG1519> Caesarea<WG2542>, and<WG2532> delivered<WG325> the epistle<WG1992> to the governor<WG2232>, presented<WG3936> Paul<WG3972> also<WG2532> before him<WG846>.

And<WG1161> when the governor<WG2232> had read<WG314> the letter<WG2532>, he asked<WG1905> of<WG1537> what<WG4169> province<WG1885> he was<WG2076>. And<WG2532> when he understood<WG4441> that<WG3754> he was of<WG575> Cilicia<WG2791>;

I will hear<WG1251> thee<WG4675>, said he<WG5346>, when<WG3752> thine<WG4675> accusers<WG2725> are<WG3854> also<WG2532> come<WG3854>. And<WG5037> he commanded<WG2753> him<WG846> to be kept<WG5442> in<WG1722> Herod's<WG2264> judgment hall<WG4232>.
